title: 112_hr6397
content: The Act titled "Defending American Taxpayers From Abusive Government Takings Act of 2012" prohibits the use of eminent domain power. The Act "Defending American Taxpayers From Abusive Government Takings Act of 2012" prohibits Fannie Mae and Freddie Mac from purchasing mortgages secured by properties in counties where eminent domain was used to obtain residential mortgage loans in the past 120 months. The Act prohibits Freddie Mac from purchasing mortgages secured by properties in counties where eminent domain was used to obtain residential mortgage loans in the past 120 months. FHA is also affected by this restriction. The Act prohibits the Secretary from insuring mortgages secured by properties obtained through eminent domain in the past 120 months. This restriction also applies to FHA. "SEC. 3737. PROHIBITION ON USE OF EMINENT DOMAIN POWER." The Secretary is prohibited from guaranteeing, making, or insuring a loan for a residence in a county that contains a property obtained through eminent domain in the past 120 months. Definitions for "residential mortgage loan" and "State" are provided in this section. The table of sections in the chapter is amended to include a new item after section 3736. Prohibition relating to use of power of eminent domain.
